title: How to Do Your Hair Like Alice Cullen's Hair

steps.headline: Get a short pixie-like haircut.
steps.description: Alice's pixie cut is about down to her chin but higher in some places. You can do this if your hair is a little longer just make sure you have short layers.

steps.headline: Wash your hair before you style it.
steps.description: Do this so you can get out the previous products in your hair.If you take a shower at night blow dry your hair as usual. (optional)

steps.headline: Set up your straightener on HIGH or else it won't flip out right.
While your straightener is warming up spray your whole head of hair with a reliable hairspray, this will make it so the flip will stay in place before hand.
steps.description: Also spray your hair "upside down" and shake your hair lightly

steps.headline: Once you have sprayed your hair take your heated straightener and grab a section of your hair, don't make the section to large, and take the straightener and curve outward and inward on the hair to make sure it flips out into styled disarray.
Repeat for each section of hair.
steps.description: Try  to use very reliable hairspray and re-spray the side you started with first then do the other side.

steps.headline: For the first time, wash your hair using good shampoo.
then, dry your hair like normal.
Get a hairdryer and either a small comb or a roller (curler) comb.
With the hairdryer on, get the end of your hair and wrap it around the comb outwards, like you are curling it.
steps.description: Don't do it too much or too high-It will make it curl up too much.

steps.headline: With the hair still twisted around the comb, dry it with the hairdryer.
Do this with all your hair.
steps.description: If you have a fringe,  put it to the left side

steps.headline: In the morning, it should have remain sticking upwards.
steps.description: You might need to repeat this process once every few days. During the days you are not going to repeat the process, in the morning get a wet comb and twirl the bits that need twisting.

text: Steps Get a short pixie-like haircut. Alice's pixie cut is about down to her chin but higher in some places. You can do this if your hair is a little longer just make sure you have short layers. Wash your hair before you style it. Do this so you can get out the previous products in your hair.If you take a shower at night blow dry your hair as usual. (optional) Set up your straightener on HIGH or else it won't flip out right.  While your straightener is warming up spray your whole head of hair with a reliable hairspray, this will make it so the flip will stay in place before hand. Also spray your hair "upside down" and shake your hair lightly Once you have sprayed your hair take your heated straightener and grab a section of your hair, don't make the section to large, and take the straightener and curve outward and inward on the hair to make sure it flips out into styled disarray.  Repeat for each section of hair. Try  to use very reliable hairspray and re-spray the side you started with first then do the other side. Thick Hair For the first time, wash your hair using good shampoo.  then, dry your hair like normal.  Get a hairdryer and either a small comb or a roller (curler) comb.  With the hairdryer on, get the end of your hair and wrap it around the comb outwards, like you are curling it. Don't do it too much or too high-It will make it curl up too much. With the hair still twisted around the comb, dry it with the hairdryer.  Do this with all your hair. If you have a fringe,  put it to the left side In the morning, it should have remain sticking upwards. You might need to repeat this process once every few days. During the days you are not going to repeat the process, in the morning get a wet comb and twirl the bits that need twisting. Finished.
sentences: Steps Get a short pixie-like haircut.
Alice's pixie cut is about down to her chin but higher in some places.
You can do this if your hair is a little longer just make sure you have short layers.
Wash your hair before you style it.
Do this so you can get out the previous products in your hair.If you take a shower at night blow dry your hair as usual.
(optional) Set up your straightener on HIGH or else it won't flip out right.
While your straightener is warming up spray your whole head of hair with a reliable hairspray, this will make it so the flip will stay in place before hand.

Also spray your hair "upside down" and shake your hair lightly Once you have sprayed your hair take your heated straightener and grab a section of your hair, don't make the section to large, and take the straightener and curve outward and inward on the hair to make sure it flips out into styled disarray.
Repeat for each section of hair.
Try  to use very reliable hairspray and re-spray the side you started with first then do the other side.
Thick Hair For the first time, wash your hair using good shampoo.
then, dry your hair like normal.
Get a hairdryer and either a small comb or a roller (curler) comb.
With the hairdryer on, get the end of your hair and wrap it around the comb outwards, like you are curling it.
Don't do it too much or too high-It will make it curl up too much.
With the hair still twisted around the comb, dry it with the hairdryer.
Do this with all your hair.
If you have a fringe,  put it to the left side In the morning, it should have remain sticking upwards.
You might need to repeat this process once every few days.
During the days you are not going to repeat the process, in the morning get a wet comb and twirl the bits that need twisting.
Finished.
